org.spongepowered.api.world.gen.populators

Interface Flowers

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Populator

    public interface Flowers
extends Populator
    Represents a populator which uses perlin noise to scatter flowers randomly around a chunk.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Flowers.Builder
      A builder for constructing Flowers populators.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFlowersPerChunk()
      Gets the number of flowers to attempt to spawn per chunk, must be greater than zero.
      Optional<PlantType> getFlowerType()
      Gets the plant type for this populator to spawn.
      boolean isBiomeDependent()
      Gets whether this populator will ignore the set plant type and default to the biome's flower type.
      void serFlowerType(PlantType type)
      Sets the plant type for this populator to spawn.
      void setBiomeDependent(boolean state)
      Sets whether this populator will ignore the set tile and default to the biome's flower type.
      void setFlowersPerChunk(int count)
      Sets the number of flowers to attempt to spawn per chunk, must be greater than zero.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.world.gen.Populator

        populate

    • Method Detail

      • getFlowersPerChunk

        int getFlowersPerChunk()
        Gets the number of flowers to attempt to spawn per chunk, must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        The number to spawn

      • setFlowersPerChunk

        void setFlowersPerChunk(int count)
        Sets the number of flowers to attempt to spawn per chunk, must be greater than zero.
        Parameters:
        count - The new amount to spawn

      • isBiomeDependent

        boolean isBiomeDependent()
        Gets whether this populator will ignore the set plant type and default to the biome's flower type.
        Returns:
        Is biome dependent

      • setBiomeDependent

        void setBiomeDependent(boolean state)
        Sets whether this populator will ignore the set tile and default to the biome's flower type.
        Parameters:
        state - The new biome dependency state

      • getFlowerType

        Optional<PlantType> getFlowerType()
        Gets the plant type for this populator to spawn. If the populator is flagged as being biome dependent ( isBiomeDependent() ) then this will return absent.
        Returns:
        The plant type, or absent if this is biome dependent

      • serFlowerType

        void serFlowerType(PlantType type)
        Sets the plant type for this populator to spawn. This will automatically set the isBiomeDependent() flag to false.
        Parameters:
        type - The plant type to spawn
